channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rentals Cool—Here’s Where Concessions Are Picking Up
item.description: The rental market has been on a downward trajectory for a while, but now a third of landlords are offering concessions.

item.title: Typing these four characters could crash your iPhone
item.description: A bug in the iPhone makes it crash just by typing four characters. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Prosecutors Fight Exonerations
item.description: As laws are passed to support the wrongfully convicted, some officials in the legal system push back.

item.title: Where We’d Invest in Real Estate in 2024 if We Were Starting from Scratch
item.description: New to real estate investing? In the beginning, you’re drowning in recommendations of where to invest in real estate, especially in 2024. Everyone is shouting different markets at you, “Cleveland! […]

item.title: Anthropic’s Claude surpasses $1M in mobile app revenue
item.description: However, Claude is still ranking far behind top rival ChatGPT. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: FAQ: How The Marshall Project Is Covering the 2024 Election
item.description: Learn more about who we are and how we choose what political stories to cover.

item.title: Making $300K+ Profit Per Rental and Scaling FAST with “DADUs”
item.description: Making a $300,000 profit from ONE rental?! Imagine how quickly you could reach financial freedom by raking in this amount of profit and reinvesting it into your real estate portfolio. […]

item.title: This Week in AI: Gen Z has mixed feelings on AI
item.description: This week, surveys suggest that Gen Z — regularly the subject of mainstream media fascination — has very mixed opinions on AI. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Mother on a Mission for Full Police Transparency
item.description: Troy, Alabama, police severely beat Ulysses Wilkerson when he was 17. Seven years later, his mom, Angela Williams, is still fighting for answers.

item.title: Commercial Brokerage JLL Takes $18 Million Loss In Loan Fraud Scheme
item.description: DOJ investigators discovered a multiyear scheme regarding fraudulent loans that led to an $18 million loss for JLL.

item.title: Volkswagen ID.Buzz electric minivan will cost $59,995 for just 234 miles of range
item.description: For the price, buyers will get a well-equipped electric minivan that falls a bit short on range. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How the 1968 DNC in Chicago Devolved into ‘Unrestrained and Indiscriminate Police Violence’
item.description: As protesters prepare for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago next week, a half-century old report provides lessons for preventing chaos.

item.title: FIRE in 2024: What We’d Do Differently If We Started Over Today
item.description: 2013 was a pivotal year for our hosts. Scott was fresh out of college and just beginning his journey to financial independence, while Mindy and her husband were well on […]

item.title: Bodies of Autonomy founder Mike Lynch and his daughter recovered from sunken Bayesian yacht
item.description: Grim news coming in from Sicily, Italy. Mike Lynch, the U.K. investor and founder of IT company Autonomy, has been identified as one of two bodies recovered from the Bayesian, the yacht that sunk off the coast of Sicily early Monday, according to several reports coming out of the country that cite the Chief of […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Aaron Sankin is The Marshall Project’s new Deputy Data Editor
item.description: Sankin brings deep experience with ambitious data projects.
